video_description:
Google Nexus 7 Review - A Solid Tablet at Any Price

The TechnoBuffalo team was fortunate enough to get our hands on the Google Nexus 7 from Google I/O 2012. I used it all weekend and, quite frankly, it's a wonderful device. You're in luck if you're in the market for an inexpensive tablet; this product is feature rich, low-priced and Google is well positioned to sell lots of units. Check out our review and to see why we highly recommend the Nexus 7...

Read the full Nexus 7 Review on TechnoBuffalo:
http://tchno.be/NuqnE9

Follow Us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/technobuffalo

Like Us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/technobuffalo

Check Us Out on Google+: http://tchno.be/qxgw8y

Inside My Mind: http://www.youtube.com/insidejonsmind
title: Google Nexus 7 Review

comments.text: This is one of the best tablets currently available as it is available in all price ranges (comparing it to a kindle was a bad idea... as the kindle has a third of the power that this monster has. comments.author: StLoveLess

comments.text: Because of this fact having 2 of these things to equal another tablet of similar price value will bring you up to a decent amount of storage space (please also note that there are storage managing apps on the market) it is very likely that you will never need 16GB of storage space unless dealing with movies,﻿ and because this is a network enabled device (and you likely do not watch many movies on the go) you will not need that space in the long run to begin with

comments.text: Also to note, videos will only play in 720P on this device, meaning those gigantic ass movies you have will not run in full quality on this device anyways, rendering their size practically useless and these videos should be scaled down before placed on the device in the first place, you really cannot go wrong with this device at all, in any way.
